before_start: {"blocks":[{"key":"cc97p","text":"Experimental Outline ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":21},{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":21}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"p1qa","text":"Cells are seeded at 30-50k cells/well and maintained in cell culture media until the desired experimental endpoint. Initial plating densities should be optimized for each cell type or cell line to provide optimal survival rates, morphology, and differentiation at final timepoint. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2sbt4","text":"When cells are ready to be stained, the protocol diverges into 2 separate series of steps: ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7ltpe","text":" - Probing and imaging live cells ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5prq8","text":" - Treating, staining, and imaging fixed cells. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9lk2b","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4u2db","text":"This protocol can be applied to different cell types for the assessment of lysosomal functions. Here we apply it to induced pluripotent stem cells differentiated into Ventral Medial Dopaminergic neurons (protocol available at 10.17504/protocols.io.bu7ynzpw) or cortical neurons (protocol available at 10.17504/protocols.io.bu6znzf6). Cortical neurons were cultured until DIV50 and ventral medial dopaminergic neurons cultured until DIV40.  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":226,"length":30},{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":301,"length":30}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":226,"length":30},{"key":1,"offset":301,"length":30}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"cellsMeta":{"0_0":"","0_1":"","0_2":"","0_3":"","1_0":"","1_1":"","1_2":"","1_3":"","2_0":"","2_1":"","2_2":"","2_3":"","3_0":"","3_1":"","3_2":"","3_3":"","4_0":"","4_1":"","4_2":"","4_3":"","5_0":"","5_1":"","5_2":"","5_3":""},"colTitles":[],"colWidths":[86,86,119,103],"data":[["Antibodies\u0026nbsp;","Species\u0026nbsp;","Source\u0026nbsp;","Cat description: {"blocks":[{"key":"5i4u3","text":"This protocol describes the preparation and treatment of neuronal cultures to be imaged for its analysis using the Opera Phenix high-content screening system. This includes the preparation of the cultures and its treatment to stain Lysosomes using a lysosome staining reagent, the treatment with DQ-red BSA to analyse lysosomal activity and the fixation and staining of the autophagic markers P62 and LC3 in the presence and absence of the autophagy-lysosomal pathway inhibitor Bafilomycin A1. Quantification of autophagy measures or autophagy flux in the presence and absence of bafilomycin A1 treatment offers a dynamic readout of the autophagy state that cannot be captured otherwise in immunostaining and western blot experiments. The aim of this protocol is to provide a guideline for stain and image any cell line for its analysis using a high content imaging system, allowing the process of large number of conditions/cell lines for the measurement of lysosomal and autophagosomal phenotypes. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
guidelines: {"blocks":[{"key":"eedhn","text":"Please refer to the Harmony software manual (https://www.perkinelmer.com/uk/product/harmony-4-9-office-license-hh17000010) for assistance in setting imaging parameters.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":45,"length":76}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":45,"length":76}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"2035B2BED5AF11EE97970A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://www.perkinelmer.com/uk/product/harmony-4-9-office-license-hh17000010"}}}}
materials_text:
{"blocks":[{"key":"6tah3","text":"Consumables 
96 well-plates from Perkin Elmer: CELLCARRIER-96 ULTRA Black with clear bottom, TC treated, sterile with lid (catalogue no. 6055300) ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":12},{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":12}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6gpag","text":"
Reagents 
For live cells: 
Cell culture media* (refer to ‘material input’ section for details) 
DQ-red BSA (ThermoFisher D12051) 
Lysosomal Staining Reagent- Orange-Cytopainter (abcam ab176827) 
Mitotracker deep red (ThermoFisher M22426) 
Cell proliferation staining reagent – Green fluorescence – Cytopainter (abcam ab176735) 
PUREBLUTM Hoesht 33342 (Bio-Rad #1351304) 
For fixed cells: 
Triton X100 (Sigma #T8787-100ml) 
Bovine serum albumin (Bovostar BSAS-AU 500g) 
Paraformaldehyde (Sigma #ACR416780010) 
Bafilomycin A1 (B1793-10UG) 
DAPI nuclear stain 
Antibodies: ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":1,"length":9},{"style":"italic","offset":1,"length":9},{"style":"italic","offset":11,"length":17},{"style":"italic","offset":372,"length":17}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"aqka4","text":"
","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"hjpv","text":" These antibodies are included to identify desired cell populations and can be substituted as required for different differentiation protocols. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6drqm","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"aosv3","text":"Solutions  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":11},{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":11}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6dbc6","text":"Fixing solution: 4% PFA in 1xPBS ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":15}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dskec","text":"Blocking buffer: 3% BSA + 0.1% Triton X-100 in 1 x PBS ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":16}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2evvf","text":"Permeabilization buffer: 0.3% Triton X-100 in 1 x PBS ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":24}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7jcjl","text":"Antibodies dilution solution: antibodies are prepared in blocking buffer ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":28}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fah9p","text":"Washing solution: 1x PBS ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":18}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"34iuu","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"tables","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"cellsMeta":{"0_0":"","0_1":"","0_2":"","0_3":"","1_0":"","1_1":"","1_2":"","1_3":"","2_0":"","2_1":"","2_2":"","2_3":"","3_0":"","3_1":"","3_2":"","3_3":"","4_0":"","4_1":"","4_2":"","4_3":"","5_0":"","5_1":"","5_2":"","5_3":""},"colTitles":[],"colWidths":[86,86,119,103],"data":[["Antibodies ","Species ","Source ","Cat status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.step:
{"blocks":[{"key":"6d0j1","text":"1. Prepare: DQ-red-BSA 1:100, Cytopainter green cell proliferation reagent 1:500 and Hoechst 1:100 in complete cell culture media. 
Alternatively prepare: Mitotracker 1:10.000, Lysosomal staining 1:500, Cytopainter 1:500 and Hoechst 1:100 in complete cell culture media. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"csgai","text":"
2. Gently replace cell culture media on the cells with the prepared solution ( /well)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":79,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"c66uc","text":" 
3. Cells are imaged 15, 45 and 90 minutes after adding the probes using the Opera Phenix high-content screening system. Hoechst, Alexa488 and Alexa561 Laser/filter pairs are used for DQ-red BSA treatment imaging. Hoechst, Alexa488, Alexa561 and Alexa647 laser/filter pairs are used to image Mitotracker/Lysosomal probes. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1ekna","text":" 
Suggested Imaging conditions: 
 40x water objective, 3 z-steps, at least 25 fields of view, imaging done in cell culture conditions ( , 5% CO2).  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":135,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"6gnel","text":"
Note: 40x objective is needed to obtain enough detail for accurate Lysosome-Mitophagy analysis. Z-step and fields of view are selected to obtain enough images without compromising the time it takes to finish a round of imaging. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":1,"length":6}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"100","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"1":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"37","unit":10}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9qo2f","text":"Step 1: (bafilomycin treatment and fixation)  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":0,"length":45}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6g9gg","text":"1. To treat the cells, cell culture media is replaced with   media containing   bafilomycin A1, and incubated at  , 5%CO2 for  .  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":59,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":78,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":113,"length":1},{"key":3,"offset":126,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"7bq7l","text":"
2. After 4h cells are fixed in 2 steps to avoid detachment: ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f1uro","text":"
3. Remove   of the culture media and replace with the same volume of 4% PFA, incubate at   in the dark for  .  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":4,"offset":11,"length":1},{"key":5,"offset":90,"length":1},{"key":6,"offset":108,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"6phfd","text":"
4. Remove mixture of cell culture media and PFA gently and replace with   of 4% PFA and incubate for  . ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":7,"offset":73,"length":1},{"key":8,"offset":102,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"23fcp","text":"
5. Remove PFA solution and gently wash with 1x PBS. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5mme6","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6o9vm","text":"Cells can be stored in PBS at  before commencing staining. (At this point plates can be used for later steps of permeabilization, blocking and staining or can be stored at   in the dark for several days). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":9,"offset":30,"length":1},{"key":10,"offset":172,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"82mnn","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"150","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}},"1":{"type":"concentration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"concentration":"400","error_concentration":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":30}},"10":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"4","unit":10}},"2":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"37","unit":10}},"3":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":14400,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"4":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"75","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"5":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"","unit":32}},"6":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":600,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"7":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"70","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"8":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":900,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"9":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"4","unit":10}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8d5qe","text":"Step 2 staining with primary antibodies: 
1. Discard 1x PBS solution from wells and add permeabilization buffer (  per well), incubate for  . ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":0,"length":39}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":113,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":139,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"ag9hb","text":"
2. Discard permeabilization buffer and add blocking buffer (  per well), incubate for  . ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":61,"length":1},{"key":3,"offset":87,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"785d","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fiq0t","text":"3. Prepare antibody combinations to desired final concentrations in blocking buffer, discard blocking buffer from plates and replace with primary antibody dilutions, incubate overnight at  . ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":4,"offset":188,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"bi088","text":"
4. Wash cells with 1x PBS for   (3 times) ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":5,"offset":31,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"3ol2j","text":"
5. Add secondary antibodies diluted (1:500) in blocking buffer to cells ( per well), incubate for   at  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":6,"offset":74,"length":1},{"key":7,"offset":99,"length":1},{"key":8,"offset":103,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"b0ua0","text":"
6. Wash cells with 1x PBS for  (2 times). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":9,"offset":30,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"b0bmo","text":"
7. Add 1x PBS with DAPI, incubate for at least  . ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":10,"offset":48,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"5u2si","text":"
8. Wash cells with 1x PBS, leave in   of 1x PBS  per well to avoid drying out. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":11,"offset":37,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"dshio","text":"
9. Plates are now ready to be imaged. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9ndlr","text":"
Suggested Imaging conditions:  
40x water objective, 10 z-steps (0.5mm step size as recommended by the manufacturer), at least 46 fields of view per well (covering 16% of the well’s area). 
","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4fvk0","text":"Note: Imaging conditions are selected taking into consideration the detail needed (analysis of organelles need higher magnification), and the minimum number of cells needed to obtain a robust result (if the culture has very little number of cells, more fields of view could be needed). Please refer to the Harmony software manual (https://www.perkinelmer.com/uk/product/harmony-4-9-office-license-hh17000010) for assistance in setting imaging parameters. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":5},{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":331,"length":76}],"entityRanges":[{"key":12,"offset":331,"length":76}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"100","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"1":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":1200,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"10":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":420,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"11":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"200","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"12":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"D5ADD344D5AD11EE97970A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://www.perkinelmer.com/uk/product/harmony-4-9-office-license-hh17000010"}},"2":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"100","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"3":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":3600,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"4":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"4","unit":10}},"5":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":300,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"6":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"100","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"7":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":3600,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"8":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"tempera
